name: ringmnd

stmt.origin: syl(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(c0, cmnd), wcel(c0, cgrp))
stmt.pretty: syl(c0 ∈ Ring, c0 ∈ Mnd, c0 ∈ Grp)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(c0, cmnd))
-| wi(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(c0, cgrp))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c0, cmnd))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ Ring → c0 ∈ Mnd)
⊣ (c0 ∈ Ring → c0 ∈ Grp)
⊣ (c0 ∈ Grp → c0 ∈ Mnd)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(c0, cmnd))
-| wi(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(c0, cgrp))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c0, cmnd))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ Ring → c0 ∈ Mnd)
⊣ (c0 ∈ Ring → c0 ∈ Grp)
⊣ (c0 ∈ Grp → c0 ∈ Mnd)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(c0, cmnd))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c0, cmnd))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ Ring → c0 ∈ Mnd)
⊣ (c0 ∈ Grp → c0 ∈ Mnd)

comment: A ring is a monoid under addition. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Jan-2015.)
